components.description:
A yellow face with tears welling up at the bottom of its two large eyes.

May be used to express a range of emotions including sadness, anger, embarrassment, admiration, and gratitude. 

ü•≤ Smiling Face with Tear and ü•∫ Pleading Face can be used in some similar contexts.

Unlike other vendors, Huawei's design shows this emoji holding its hands expectantly against its cheeks.
components.title: Face Holding Back Tears

description:

title: Face Holding Back Tears

version.description:
Unicode 14.0 is the version of the Unicode Standard released on September 14, 2021. 37 new emoji code points were added in this release, with all 112 new emojis (including sequences for skin tones) listed under Emoji 14.0.

New emojis added in this release are update expected to come to major platforms in either late 2021 or early 2022.

This release of this Unicode Standard was delayed from March 2021 due to COVID-19. 

  • üìù Unicode 14.0 details on Unicode.org

apple_vendor_description: The face holding back tears emoji on Apple devices presents a classic yellow face with wide, slightly downturned eyes and a furrowed brow, conveying a strong sense of suppressed emotion. Its signature Apple 3D shading adds a subtle sheen, highlighting the glistening tears held just at the brink of falling. This emoji masterfully captures the feeling of being overwhelmed, embarrassed, or deeply touched, often used when trying to maintain composure despite strong feelings.
